description: From Middle English totheles, toþeles, from Old English tōþlēas, from Proto-Germanic *tanþlausaz (“toothless”), equivalent to tooth +‎ -less. Cognate with Dutch tandeloos (“toothless”), German Low German tannlos (“toothless”), German zahnlos (“toothless”), Danish tandløs (“toothless”), Swedish tandlös (“toothless”), Icelandic tannlaus (“toothless”).

adjectives.description: toothless (comparative more toothless, superlative most toothless)

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Weak; having no ability to enforce something.
examples: The treaty was toothless because of the lack of participation from the undersigned.
